item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (83 points | 17 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (380 points | 264 comments)
3. Show HN: Buckaroo – The data table UI for Notebooks (14 points | 1 comment)
4. Spaced Repetition Memory System (13 points | discuss)
5. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (102 points | 35 comments)
6. Show HN: Racketmeter – Measure Badminton String Tension Using Sound Frequency (3 points | discuss)
7. Apple Card Disabled My iCloud, App Store, and Apple ID Accounts (2021) (106 points | 52 comments)
8. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (99 points | 6 comments)
9. Measure EEG with Arduino (14 points | 6 comments)
10. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (3 points | discuss)
11. Magic Leap One Bootloader Exploit (29 points | 2 comments)
12. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (5 points | 2 comments)
13. Coding without a laptop: Two weeks with AR glasses and Linux on Android (876 points | 330 comments)
14. Working with Git Patches in Apple Mail (2023) (27 points | 9 comments)
15. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (298 points | 150 comments)
16. Pluto Flyover from New Horizons (27 points | 4 comments)

18. Building my childhood dream PC (16 points | 2 comments)
19. Solar grants held hostage in Pennsylvania legislature – as demand soars (23 points | 26 comments)
20. Show HN: A web browser agent in your Chrome side panel (75 points | 46 comments)
21. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (136 points | 98 comments)
22. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (3 points | discuss)
23. What do wealthy people buy, that ordinary people know nothing about? (2015) (52 points | 26 comments)
24. Paper Mechanisms (38 points | 1 comment)
25. Lessons from Mixing Rust and Java: Fast, Safe, and Practical (101 points | 27 comments)
26. How the Sun Enterprise 10000 was born (2007) (44 points | 37 comments)
27. High Available Mosquitto MQTT on Kubernetes (33 points | 14 comments)
28. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (59 points | 31 comments)
29. Mystical (314 points | 38 comments)
30. Show HN: Turn any workflow diagram into compilable, running and stateful code (84 points | 19 comments)
